titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Joseph Shattan papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Loralee Sepsey

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-08T16:56-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Speeches of Jeane Kirkpatrick, Elliott Abrams, William Bennett, George Schultz, and Dan Quayle, letters, memoranda, testimony, bulletins, and printed matter relating to American foreign and domestic policy during the administrations of Ronald Reagan and George Bush, to human rights violations throughout the world, and to the United Nations.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joseph Shattan papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Counselor to United States Ambassador to the United Nations Jeane Kirkpatrick, 1981-1982, to Assistant Secretary of State for Human Rights Elliott Abrams, 1982-1985, to Secretary of Education William Bennett, 1985-1989, and to Vice President Dan Quayle, 1989-1991. Shattan was born in 1950 and died in 2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection contains speeches of Jeane Kirkpatrick, Elliott Abrams, William Bennett, George Schultz, and Dan Quayle, letters, memoranda, testimony, bulletins, and printed matter relating to American foreign and domestic policy during the administrations of Ronald Reagan and George Bush, to human rights violations throughout the world, and to the United Nations.

did.unittitle: "The Amsterdam News Letter to the Editor,"
"The Evolution of the Carter Administration's Human Rights Policy,"
"How Not to Talk About El Salvador,"
"Right of Reply on Self-Determination for Puerto Rico,"
"Talking Points for Chowder and Marching Society,"
"Third Committee Item 12: Human Rights in El Salvador,"
"The United States and the United Nations: Thoughts for New Themes,"
Speech on human rights and American foreign policy,
Speech on human rights in El Salvador,
Speech on higher education and Western Civilization,
Speech on human rights in the Soviet Union,
Speech on the Camp David Framework,
Speech on the President of Niger,
Speech on Central America and the Caribbean,
